job.title: Software Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Computer Software,Financial Services
job.description:
Projects The Candidate Will Be Working On
Provide support for production AWS cloud environments for a state government customer.
Ideal Background
Healthcare is a plus, but the ideal background is several years experience working in AWS supporting production workloads.
Team And Team Size
Current team is 8 members with a mixture of people being on and offshore. All the team members are DevOps engineers that are supporting the production environments.
Top Responsibilities
Work closely with the product support teams to be able to troubleshoot production issues.
Be able to deploy new releases or hotfixes to a Linux environment
Able to create new automation jobs to assist with common tasks.
Be able to manage an Oracle database so that new scripts can be run against it as well as perform ad-hoc queries
Ability to manage users/role on AD, Oracle Database, Operating System
Ability to triage infrastructure issues on Prod.
Support all production services (o EC2, EBS, S3, EFS, Cloudfront, WAF, ALB, SecretsManager,Cloudtrail, Cloudwatch, DynamoDb, Redis, SQS, SES, SNS, IAM, Inspector, Gaurdduty, Workspaces, Certificate Manager, DIrectory Services, Lambda, AWS Batch, Step Function, VPC, SG, NACL, Disaster Recovery, KMS, Oracle)
Skills/attributes Required
Linux hands on, comfortable with command line (3+ years)
AWS management (3+ years)
Oracle (2+ years)
Skills/attributes Preferred
The more experience with AWS setting up and managing services the better.
Working Time
Ability to work night shifts would be ideal.
Interview Process
How many rounds? 2 - 1 technical, 1 manager
Video, phone, or in person? Video/phone
How technical will the interviews be? Very
